posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked:
Hi there,
I‚Äôm trying to build a just cloned copy from the repository but without Angelscript and LUA, but it‚Äôs not working, its compiling ThirdParty/AngelScript and ThirdParty\LuaJIT. It used to work with the command

gradlew.bat -P ANDROID_ABI=arm64-v8a -P URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0 -P URHO3D_PCH=0 -P URHO3D_WEBP=0 -P URHO3D_LUA=0 -P URHO3D_LUAJIT=0 build

Also I‚Äôve added URHO3D_LUAJIT_AMALG=0 but the result it‚Äôs the same.
I‚Äôm missing something?
Cheers

posts.name: È≠îÂ§ßÂÜú ùûçùûéùù≥ ÁèæÊãõËúç
posts.cooked:
Try prefixing -D to the flags. Or is -P gradle logix? #gradle-to-crave

On another topic

I am done with Urho3D for now.

Dry has Lua and D3D ripped out - and shorter flag names, naturally - seems like you wouldn‚Äôt miss either.

Although you are in bat country.

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked:
From doc https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_building.html#Building_Android

The Gradle properties can be passed by using ‚Äú-P‚Äù Gradle option, e.g.: ‚Äú./gradlew -P URHO3D_LUA=0 build‚Äù to build without Lua subsystem

wait @weitjong is out too?

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked:
I think only environment variables are taken by the new build system.
Is this deliberately removed? I could submit a PR (based on previous versions of the file) to support again command line options

posts.name: Kai
posts.cooked:
Hi,

I think you can change these parameters to apply the build flags ( e.g. -D URHO3D_LUA=0):

github.com

urho3d/Urho3D/blob/eb0e7677f67296a318fa7ad3404b43a20b2cfdd0/android/urho3d-lib/build.gradle.kts#L51

    

  1. compileSdkVersion(30)
  2. defaultConfig {
  3.     minSdkVersion(18)
  4.     targetSdkVersion(30)
  5.     versionCode = 1
  6.     versionName = project.version.toString()
  7.     testInstrumentationRunner = "android.support.test.runner.AndroidJUnitRunner"
  8.     externalNativeBuild {
  9.         cmake {
  10.             arguments.apply {
  11.                 System.getenv("ANDROID_CCACHE")?.let { add("-D ANDROID_CCACHE=$it") }
  12.                 // Pass along matching env-vars as CMake build options
  13.                 addAll(project.file("../../script/.build-options")
  14.                     .readLines()
  15.                     .mapNotNull { variable -> System.getenv(variable)?.let { "-D $variable=$it" } }
  16.                 )
  17.             }
  18.             targets.add("Urho3D")
  19.         }
  20.     }
  21.     splits {
    22.

github.com

urho3d/Urho3D/blob/eb0e7677f67296a318fa7ad3404b43a20b2cfdd0/android/launcher-app/build.gradle.kts#L48

    

  1. minSdkVersion(18)
  2. targetSdkVersion(30)
  3. applicationId = "io.urho3d.launcher"
  4. versionCode = 1
  5. versionName = project.version.toString()
  6. testInstrumentationRunner = "android.support.test.runner.AndroidJUnitRunner"
  7. externalNativeBuild {
  8.     cmake {
  9.         arguments.apply {
  10.             System.getenv("ANDROID_CCACHE")?.let { add("-D ANDROID_CCACHE=$it") }
  11.             add("-D BUILD_STAGING_DIR=${findProject(":android:urho3d-lib")!!.projectDir}/$buildStagingDir")
  12.             add("-D URHO3D_PLAYER=1")
  13.             // Skip building samples for 'STATIC' lib type to reduce the spacetime requirement
  14.             add("-D URHO3D_SAMPLES=${if (System.getenv("URHO3D_LIB_TYPE") == "SHARED") "1" else "0"}")
  15.             // Pass along matching env-vars as CMake build options
  16.             addAll(project.file("../../script/.build-options")
  17.                 .readLines()
  18.                 .filterNot { listOf("URHO3D_PLAYER", "URHO3D_SAMPLES").contains(it) }
  19.                 .mapNotNull { variable -> System.getenv(variable)?.let { "-D $variable=$it" } }
  20.             )
  21.         }
    22.

Hope it helps!

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked: Yes, you‚Äôre right but by this way options are hardcoded in the build file. Before you could pass this options through command line.

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked: I‚Äôve found a way with previous build files and submit a PR. Still it would be nice to know why this changes were deliberately removed. Thanks anyway.

posts.name: Thomas Trocha
posts.cooked:
when I see it right all you need to do is to export the cmake-options as environment-variable.

In liinux:

export URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0

I guess in win (not sure ):

set URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0

And then call gradlew

ps: for me to compile the example at all I had to set URHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED

posts.name: Yao Wei Tjong
posts.cooked:
Sorry for late answer. In the last Gradle build system refactoring I have decided to remove the support for using ‚Äú-P‚Äù to pass through the build option in order to simplify the build script and to reduce the possibility of conflict. The documentation file has been updated accordingly. If you guys ever look at the commit itself, you know it is intentional. Note that the site is no longer updated automatically anymore.

github.com/urho3d/Urho3D

Major refactoring on the Gradle build system.

committed 05:32PM - 05 Oct 20 UTC
weitjong
+519 -529

Using ‚Äúrake‚Äù command, the build option can be passed like this:

$ rake URHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0 PLATFORM=android

It works on all host systems with Ruby/Rake installed. The last PLATFORM env-var is not needed when the command is invoked inside a running Android DBE docker container.

It is also possible to use ‚Äúgradlew‚Äù directly like this:

$ URHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0 ./gradlew build

However, this won‚Äôt work on Windows. You may have to create a simple wrapper yourself to set the env-var before invoking gradlew.

link_counts.title: Major refactoring on the Gradle build system. ¬∑ urho3d/Urho3D@0d4e038 ¬∑ GitHub

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked: That‚Äôs ok, I didn‚Äôt know that the doc page doesn‚Äôt update anymore, so I thought that you can still pass the options from the list. Well I guess that if it was intentionally removed we have revert the PR

posts.name: Thomas Trocha
posts.cooked:
extobias:

That‚Äôs ok, I didn‚Äôt know that the doc page doesn‚Äôt update anymore

The problem is that the docs of 1.7.1 are shown as default (can we change this somehow?). You need to set this to ‚ÄòHEAD‚Äô (to be honest, I also struggled with that)

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked: In HEAD still says that you have a list of supported Gradle properties.

posts.name: Yao Wei Tjong
posts.cooked: Slightly off-topic and for those who has not keep track of all the recent threads. The migration from Travis CI to GitHub Action CI/CD was kind of being rushed. The new CI/CD workflow has not reached the feature parity with the old one yet when I made the cut over. The site documentation update is one of the thing missing. There are people trying to play ‚Äúpolitic‚Äù in this project. May be not the best way to describe it but I have lost interest to complete what I have started. So, let the project die slowly and let those people happy.

posts.name: È≠îÂ§ßÂÜú ùûçùûéùù≥ ÁèæÊãõËúç
posts.cooked: Let's run...

posts.name: tobias alarcon
posts.cooked:
Sad news indeed, but somehow you could see it coming. There is anywhere some doc about the features missing in the new workflow? Just in case that someday someone want to take the lead.
And @weitjong thanks for your contribution.

posts.name: Yao Wei Tjong
posts.cooked: There is no roadmap nor migration plan. In fact I didn‚Äôt even know how to do GitHub Actions workflow a few months back when I started, the main reason I did it is simply to learn new skill for myself. Anyway, one can just compare between the old Rakefile and the new rakefile to spot any missing logic not yet migrated over. It is an apple to orange comparison though as the underlying design has changed.
